TopicTitle: KSP 24.2 and MJ2 2.3.0- MJ keeps crashing my ships!

Articles.Content:
Landing is HARD. I mean, like HARD. So I figured I'd get MechJeb to do it. But it doesn't do any better than I do. Some would say worse. I can get to the Mun, but the landing autopilot simply refuses to work, only starting the engines a few seconds before touchdown- every time, no matter what.

I have reinstalled MechJeb and saw no improvement.

Uninstall MJ and try installing the latest development release.

http://jenkins.mumech.com/job/MechJeb2/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/jenkins-MechJeb2-308/MechJeb2-2.3.1.308-308.zip

Uninstall MJ and try installing the latest development release.

http://jenkins.mumech.com/job/MechJeb2/lastSuccessfulBuild/artifact/jenkins-MechJeb2-308/MechJeb2-2.3.1.308-308.zip

It worked, once. They're still plummeting into the Mun, firing their retrorockets far too late. I should mention I also have chatterer installed, but that's the only other mod.
Ok, please follow the guidelines in the sticky, and (in doing so, because it mentions it) post the issue to the MechJeb repo where Sarbian et al can have a look at it.
Nvm. Thanks for the help, I'll see what they can do

I have many mods, including MechJeb and Chatterer. The usual cause of crashing rather than landing is due to turning on Autoland too late. Any ship coming in for a landing needs a specific amount of DeltaV to counteract the ship's speed. If you enable Autoland when you're too close to the surface and moving too fast, you will crash every time. The easiest way to land is to first get into a stable circular orbit, then in the Autoland window click the box that says something like, "Select spot to land". Pick a place on the planet's surface then engage autopilot.
